  • Clinical medicinal products

Mirena20micrograms/24hours intrauterine device

  • Indications and doses
  • Cautions
  • Prescribing and dispensing

Indications and doses

Contraception, Menorrhagia,

By intra-uterine administration

  • For adults females of childbearing potential
    Insert into uterine cavity within 7 days of onset of menstruation, or any time if replacement, or any time if reasonably certain woman is not pregnant and there is no risk of conception (additional precautions (e.g. barrier methods) necessary for next 7 days), or immediately after first-trimester termination by curettage; postpartum insertions should be delayed until at least 4 weeks after delivery; effective for 5 years.

Prevention of endometrial hyperplasia during oestrogen replacement therapy,

By intra-uterine administration

  • For adults females of childbearing potential
    Insert during last days of menstruation or withdrawal bleeding or at any time if amenorrhoeic; effective for 4 years.

Cautions regarding administration

  • Advanced uterine atrophy

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

When system is removed (and not immediately replaced) and pregnancy is not desired, remove during the first few days of menstruation, otherwise additional precautions (e.g. barrier methods) should be used for at least 7 days before removal.
